column4: hi huys, i want to use the latest version of amarok, to do so i see i must use the dapper packages (else there are dependency problems) do you think im safe to upgrade to dapper?
go to that link there is amarok repos
what do you mean there isnt?
1st mistake was mixing breezy and dappers repos
run sudo apt-get update and paste the full thing to me on pastebin please
go to kubuntu's main page i think its kubuntu.com and you will see different "working" repos for kubuntu and amarok
seems that amarok is no more releasing breezuy packages. latest trunks are available only for dapper
do you think Ill break my distro if I upgrade to dapper now?
theres that chance but its for most part "safe" or atleast the devel team feels it is

i suggest if you want to upgrade to first make sure ubuntu-desktop is installed or kubuntu-desktop if using kde than changing sources.list to dappers list (will have ubotu send you list) and than sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get dist-upgrade
the devel team for kubuntu uses kubuntu
use the link that ends in 6666 and replace yours with that
i dont get the "6666", what do you mean with that number?
